subject: new ui + layout
header: feat: new ui + layout
body:
* new component `MathInput` which combines a mathquill input and a
`Keypad`.
* `Keypad` has been re-written to:
  * improve it's layout
  * make it more configurable
* `HorizontalKeypad` has been rewritten to use the new `Keypad`.
footer:
BREAKING CHANGE:
* The ui is quite different now
* Some of the old components are gone (except for HorizontalKeypad which
is retained for backward compatibility).

notes.title: BREAKING CHANGE
notes.text:
* The ui is quite different now
* Some of the old components are gone (except for HorizontalKeypad which
is retained for backward compatibility).

subject: emit latex wrapped in brackets
header: fix(math): emit latex wrapped in brackets
body:
The math plugin was emitting raw latex, but needs to wrap it in brackets like so: '\(latex\)'.
Changed the attribute name to 'data-latex' instead of 'data-mathjax'.

Note: there is an outstanding issue that some characters are escaped in the latex like: `<`, but it doesn't affect Katex rendering so going to proceed with this release.

subject: fix lint issues
header: chore: fix lint issues

subject: Update toolbar api to provide better separation between react components and slate and move math editing to toolbar to simplify ui
header: feat: Update toolbar api to provide better separation between react components and slate and move math editing to toolbar to simplify ui
body:
The toolbar api has been updated so that you can write your toolbar logic as pure React components without having to know about Slate at all.
The glue from slate -> React is done in the plugin's `customToolbar` method. To update React -> slate you apply the change when you update in your toolbar then call the plugin's `applyChange` method.

subject: add new prop 'pluginProps'
header: feat: add new prop 'pluginProps'
body:
This prop allows you to make runtime changes that the plugin can make
use of while executing.

> At the moment it's only used to render toolbar buttons, but if needed
we can get the props to pass down to the render methods of each plugin.
